intro: Sasaella viridistriata var. vagans, commonly known as the creeping bamboo, is a variant of the green-striated sasaella. It is a perennial grass-like plant native to eastern Asia, particularly Japan. The plant features slender, arching stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a smooth, grassy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
